definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: "As soon as we rolled him over, he gasped and started crying, " Harmon says.
sentences.chinese: “我们把他翻过来，他一边喘气一边哭”哈蒙说。

sentences.english: Fry the steak for five minutes and then turn it and fry the other side.
sentences.chinese: 把牛排煎五分钟，然后翻过来再煎另一面。

sentences.english: When it turns over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 当它把一片刚落的叶子吹翻过来时。

sentences.english: 'You can't keep flipping the cushions every time a new person comes along,' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，你总不能在每次来新人的时候都把椅垫翻过来。

sentences.english: Now flip the hakama over and perform this on the other side.
sentences.chinese: 现在翻过来在另一面完成同样操作。

sentences.english: Hand turned over the securities, eying their gold seals .
sentences.chinese: 韩德把那些证券翻过来，瞅着上面打的金印。

sentences.english: If you choose to build a wall around your heart, make it low enough for love to climb over.
sentences.chinese: 如果要筑起心墙，也记得砌低点，好让爱还能翻过来。

sentences.english: She flipped an egg over in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 她把平锅里的鸡蛋猛然翻过来。

sentences.english: He emptied his pockets but couldn't find the ticket.
sentences.chinese: 他把裤袋都翻过来，还是找不到票。

sentences.english: I had to hear Beethoven before I could ask him to roll over .
sentences.chinese: 我得先听一下贝多芬曲，才能请他把唱片翻过来。

sentences.english: Reverse your sweater or you will put it on wrong side out.
sentences.chinese: 把你的羊毛衣翻过来，要不然你就穿反了。

sentences.english: Most of the dead and injured were in three carriages which were derailed and overturned.
sentences.chinese: 大部分伤亡乘客是在三节脱轨，翻过来的车厢里。

sentences.english: If anyone had turned him over, he might have survived.
sentences.chinese: 如果哪怕是有一个人把他翻过来，他都会幸免的。

sentences.english: If anyone had turned him over he might have survived.
sentences.chinese: 如果哪怕是有一个人把他翻过来，他都会幸免的。

sentences.english: Turn the cards over looking for the Wheel of Fortune . Its position gives you the answer.
sentences.chinese: 把牌翻过来寻找一下命运之轮，它的位置会给你答案。

definition: to sell at a 50% discount/to fold in two
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away
to flip over/to turn (a page)/to scroll (an electronic document)/to stir (food in a pot etc)/to move things about/to rummage
to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
